original: Johnson, Sune Edvard, kyrkoherde, Spekeröd, f. 22/10/93 i Öxabäck, Älvs-b. 1., av prosten Birger Johnson o. Berta Ardell. G. 27 m. Anna Thölén. Barn: Bo f. 28, Gunhild 29, Marika 30, Birger 32, Caspar 34, Ingrid 37. — Stud:ex. i Halmstad 13, teol. fil. ex. i Lund 14, teol. kand. 17, prakt. teol. prov s. å., prästv. i Gbg 18. V. past. pà Tjörn 18-22, i Uddevalla 22-27, kom-min. i Jörlanda 27, kyrkoh. i Spekeröd fr. 32, fängelsepastor i Uddevalla 23. Ordf. i Ucklums o. Spekeröds kyrkoråd,, kyrkostämma o. skolslyr. Pred. v. Svenshögens san. sed. 35.
translated:
Johnson, Sune Edvard, clergyman, Spekeröd, born on October 22, 1893 in Öxabäck, Älvsborg County, first-born son of the provost Birger Johnson and Berta Ardell. He married Anna Thölén in 1927. They had six children: Bo, born in 1928, Gunhild in 1929, Marika in 1930, Birger in 1932, Caspar in 1934, and Ingrid in 1937. 

He passed his student examination (equivalent to high school) in Halmstad in 1913, his Bachelor of Theology degree in Lund in 1914, his Master of Theology degree in 1917, and passed the practical theology exam the same year. He was ordained as a priest in Gothenburg in 1918. 

He worked as an assistant pastor in Tjörn from 1918 to 1922, then in Uddevalla from 1922 to 1927. He became a curate in Jörlanda in 1927, and then a vicar in Spekeröd in 1932. He also served as a prison pastor in Uddevalla from 1923. 

He served as the chairman of the Ucklum and Spekeröd church councils, church meetings, and school boards. He preached at the Svenshögen sanatorium since 1935.

structured.name: Sune Edvard Johnson

memberOf.name: Ucklum and Spekeröd Church Councils and School Boards
